responses.rationale: The segment asks a question about someone's feelings but contains no explicit calming language or keywords.
The segment asks questions about feelings and implications but contains no explicit calming language or keywords.
This is a statement about plausibility, not an explicit calming cue.
Describes asking experts about their assessment and concern level, but contains no explicit calming language.
Mentions worrying, which is the opposite of a calming cue.
Expresses dislike, not a calming sentiment or keyword.
Mentions not liking and struggling to answer about worry; no explicit calming cue is present.
Describes a past event that 'raised the specter,' which is not a calming cue.
Describes the spread of the virus, a factual account without calming language.
Describes past cases and fatalities; 'unsettling succession' is not a calming cue.
Reports a factual number of human cases without explicit calming language.
Reports a factual number of deaths without explicit calming language.
Contains 'I don't think the virus itself is necessarily any more worrying,' which is a bare negation, not an explicit calming cue.
Starts with a bare negation ('not necessarily any more worrying') and then introduces worry; no explicit calming cue.
Expresses worry and increased chances of contact, which is not calming.
Contains 'that risk hasn't changed,' a bare negation, not an explicit calming cue about low risk or safety.
Reports a past threat without explicit calming language.
Factual description of research without calming language.
Mentions fighting to publish due to concerns about dangerous work; not calming.
Mentions a debate and constraints; no explicit calming cue.
Expresses a view on the significance of an event; not a calming statement.
Describes an outbreak, sickening, and killing; not calming.
Describes euthanasia and lack of clarity; not calming.
Discusses possibility/probability of spread; not calming.
Mentions giving researchers 'pause,' which implies concern, not calming.
Reports factual numbers of infections without explicit calming language.
Expresses difficulty in assessment; not calming.
Reports a capacity of the virus; not calming.
Reports past deaths without explicit calming language.
Reports past detections without explicit calming language.
A statement about past experience; not a calming cue.
Discusses uncertainty; not calming.
Reports dead and sick birds; not calming.
Mentions not liking spread and increasing reports; 'don't appear to have changed' is a bare negation, not an explicit calming cue.
Expresses concern about quantity; not calming.
'mitigate some of the concern' is not one of the explicit calming keywords required for Q5.
Reports positive facts (rare cases, mild disease) neutrally without explicit calming language.
Factual description of a case without calming language.
Factual description of cases without calming language.
Factual description of a case without calming language.
Reports a rare severe case; not calming.
Reports a school of thought without explicit calming language.
Factual description without calming language.

Factual description of the virus without calming language.
Reports someone's worry; not calming.
Predicts a pandemic; not calming.
Predicts a pandemic and expresses uncertainty; not calming.
Reports agreement on a previous point (likely negative); not calming.
Expresses an opinion on focus; not a calming statement.
Factual background information without calming language.
Describes other viruses causing illness and fatal outcomes; not calming.
Describes finding viruses in pigs; not calming.
Suggests investment in readiness; not a statement about current safety or preparedness linked to safety.
Reports worry about eroded support; not calming.
Reports worry about public support; not calming.
Expresses difficulty in public response to a hypothetical future pandemic; not calming.
Contains 'risk to the general public remains low,' which is a bare low-risk statement, not intensified or coupled with explicit calming keywords.
Factual statement about status without calming language.
